bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: >William Sloane Kennedy to Walt Whitman, 3 February 1890
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839â€“1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

body.p: Spent last Sunday reading O'Connor's stories & roared in the Athenaeum over his ballad of Sir Ball with the Sword of Manley" I was set aglow by the hearty, bluff humor, the luxuriance & abullience ebullience of one of the characters. All of O'C's stories contain himself as one character. He always makes me better. Pity he hadn't written more. Yr card rec'd to-night this is the one peaceful hour before bed & sleep. Wife sewing[,] cats gorged with meat stretched before grate, clock ticking. Heard Booth recently in —as such.
